casebody.data:
Case No. 8,472. LOMBARD v. STILLWELL. Patents foe Inventions — Infringement — Injunction — Defendant’s Affidavits.

[Cited in 1 Brightly’s Dig. 457, to the point, that on a motion for an injunction in a patent case, it is not enough for the defendant to make oath that he manufactures under a patent granted to himself; he mint support his right, by the affidavits of third persons.J

[Decided by KANE, District Judge. Nowhere reported; opinion not now accessible.]
